column2: Reduce nutrient losses and chemical pesticides’ use by 50% in soil quality and pesticides
column5: The reduction of nutrient losses and chemical pesticides will have a positive impact on improving soil quality, which is a key aspect of target TA7.10, as it aims to improve soil quality by reducing nutrient losses and chemical pesticides’ use.

column2: Reduce nutrient losses and chemical pesticides’ use by 50% in soil quality and pesticides
column5: The implementation of target TA3.11 will contribute to the achievement of target TA7.11, as reducing nutrient losses and chemical pesticides’ use will help to improve water quality by reducing waste and pollution.

column2: All recycling shall achieve at least the following targets for recovery of materials: No later than 31 December 2027, 90% for cobalt, copper, lead, nickel
column5: The increased recovery of materials such as cobalt, copper, lead, and nickel through recycling, as stated in target TA3.12, will have a positive impact on reducing the risk and use of chemical pesticides, which is the focus of target TA6.9.

column2: All recycling shall achieve at least the following targets for recovery of materials: No later than 31 December 2027, 50% lithium
column5: The recovery of lithium through recycling, as mentioned in target TA3.13, will contribute to the reduction of the risk and use of chemical pesticides, as lithium is a key material in the production of batteries and other electronic devices, which can help reduce the reliance on chemical pesticides.

column2: The plastic part in packaging shall contain the following minimum percentage of recycled content recovered from post-consumer plastic waste
column5: The increase in recycled content in packaging, as stated in target TA3.14, will have a positive impact on reducing plastic litter at sea and microplastics released into the environment, which is a key aspect of target TA7.14.

column2: Producers of portable batteries or producer responsibility organisations shall ensure that all waste portable batteries are collected separately
column5: The separate collection of waste portable batteries, as required by target TA3.15, will contribute to the reduction of the risk and use of chemical pesticides, as the recycling of batteries can help recover valuable materials and reduce the need for primary production, which often involves the use of chemical pesticides.

column2: Producers of Light Means of Transport (LMT) batteries or producer responsibility organisations shall attain and maintain at least the following collection targets of waste LMT batteries
column5: The collection and recycling of LMT batteries, as stated in target TA3.16, will have a positive impact on reducing the risk and use of chemical pesticides, as the recycling of these batteries can help recover valuable materials and reduce the need for primary production, which often involves the use of chemical pesticides.
